feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Predictive Quantity Contract Consumption
entry.content:
Dear Team,

when I use the app Quantity Contract Consumption (App ID is F2012) the predictive consumption percentage is always 0. I followed the steps of the best practice 1QR and trained and activate the model, but the percentage remains 0.

I found the SAP Note 2947933 with this issue and tried to implement the corrections. Unfortunately it was not relevant for our systems because we use the software component S4CORE 106.

Could you help with this issue?

Best regards.

entry.title: SSO Error in SAC
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I need your help.

I have configured IAS as a proxy, and in IAS, I have set the Subject Name Identifier=employee_id

In Azure (OpenID Connection to IAS), I have added the employee_id to Additional Claims.

In the source system (Azure) in IPS, I have configured the transformation as follows:

{
"sourcePath": "$.employeeId",
"targetPath": "$.userName",
"correlationAttribute": true
}

Also in IPS transformation I replaced "sourcePath": "$.userPrincipalName" with "sourcePath": "$.employeeId".

Users are provisioned with IPS.

In IAS, the "Login Name" field for users receives the employee_id, for example, 1111. These users are then provisioned to SAC and have the employee_id (1111) in the "USER ID" field as well.

When I try to test SSO and select "Choose a user attribute to map to your Identity Provider" -> User attribute set = "USER ID", the user is not found in SAC.

The user accesses the SAC link and enters their email address. The user is authenticated in Azure, but in SAC, the user is not found.

I need help.

I can't solve this by myself.

Thank you very much !!!

entry.title: Custom Analytical Query- How to search using single mandatory filter out of many mandatory filters
entry.content:
Hi
I have Four mandatory filter fields in my Custom Analytical Query which is created using the "Custom Analytical Query" Fiori app. 

And I need to allow the user to run the query using any single or multiple field combinations of the available mandatory filter fields. 
Currently user have to select all four mandatory filters to search. If this is a Fiori app then I can define the filtration logic using JavaScript from the frontend.

Is there a way to do this?

entry.title: CDS View for Compliance Check: Which SAP User holds which values from an authorization object
entry.content:
Hi,

Requirement for compliance checks:
Is there a Standard CDS for Compliance checks, at best, listening all Users, Roles , Auth.objects and their values ?

Problem:
-Got some x100 SAP Users.
-The SAP users have a multitude of roles ( of course ...;).
-For compliance checks  I want to formulate a CDS view bringing
back all SAP users and the values of  a certain Role.

Example:
Got in many roles the authorization object F_BKPF_BUK

Want to have a list
SAP_USER   | BUKRS_VALUE
---------------+-----------------------+
MEUSER1      511
MEUSER2      803
..

or even better:

SAP_USER   | BUKRS_VALUE | AUTH_OBJECT | ROLE
---------------+-----------------------+---------------------+--------------------+
MEUSER1    | 511                      | F_BKPF_BUK   | Z1_M1_D_510
MEUSER2    | 803                      | F_BKPF_BUK   | Z1_M1_D_803
...

Solutions:
Standard CDS available ?
Any else ?

Demarcation:
Its  NOT searched how to authorize a CDS via a
CDS Auth. Object, for ex: ...(Bukrs) = aspect pfcg_auth(F_BKPF_BUK, BUKRS).

Thank You !

Best Wishes !
Martin

Regards,
Sowmiya

entry.title: Delta (pseudo) upload: Only Current and Previous Months data with CDS view S4HANA to SAC
entry.content:
Delta (pseudo) upload: Only Current and Previous Months data with CDS view S4HANA to SAC

As of now data import to SAC from S4HANA or ECC systems with delta upload is not supported, so its mandatory to upload whole Fiscal/Cal year data. Filtering on Fiscal/Cal period dynamically is also not possible in import jobs query filters. To handle following scenarios it would be good to reduce number of records during data import to SAC..

  • Number of records will increase period by period which would increase time and effort on data import process.
  • As of now import job rejected records are restricted to 2000 records only, if number of rejections are more than 2000 records not matching from public dimension master data then difficult to understand which entries are missing when the transaction is uploaded from source.

To overcome this scenario, I have developed a solution to upload from source only for Current and Previous periods so number of records imported will be reduced which helps to limit rejections also.

Upload for Current and/or Previous periods worked out from S4HANA system with CDS view using the System Date and Factory calendar.  Usually in organizations, Fiscal year and Periods with Start and End (closing) Dates are maintained in the system factory calendar as per the Calendar dates especially when companies are doing Financial Closing.

These Start and End (closing) dates with Fiscal Year and Periods are captured in the standard CDS views which reads data from Factory Closing Calendar. One of the CDS view is I_FiscalCalDatePrevFsclPeriod which captures Current/Previous periods and Year with Start and End dates.

As in below example, suppose in a company for the calendar date 12th March 2025, current Fiscal year and Periods are 2025 and 005, Previous Year and Periods are 2025, 004. 

If the Fiscal year starts on November 1st week Monday i.e. on 3rd November 2025, then current Fiscal year and Periods are 2025 and 001, Previous Year and Periods are 2024, 012.

 

Considering above date, year and period entries, I have created following custom CDS view logic using the standard CDS view I_FiscalCalDatePrevFsclPeriod, which can be used to import data from S4HANA table ACDOCA to SAC for Current and Previous periods only. 

 

In the above code 2nd row, system date has been passed to the CDS view with inner Join (Association also can be used), so only one record for the current system date will be read as below.

 

Used Case command and created following  logic with conditions:

  • If the system date matches with Calendar Date from I_FiscalCalDatePrevFsclPeriod CDS view and then Fiscal Year and current Period matches from ACDOCA transaction data then curr_period field will be populated as Y (yes). 
  • Usually in some companies’ postings could be still going on after Fiscal period end date also but for these entries Posting date should be less than or equal to Fiscal Period End Date.      In this scenario still these entries also need to be captured for current Fiscal Period.               In the second condition If the system date matches with Calendar Date from I_FiscalCalDatePrevFsclPeriod CDS view and Current Fiscal Year and Previous Fiscal Period matches with ACDOCA transaction data Current Fiscal year and Current Fiscal Period then curr_period field will populated as Y (yes). 

The output for the above conditions will be populated as below, for period 4 and 5 curr_period has been populated as Y. 

 

 

  • Same as in the 2nd point, if the postings are going on still for period 012 when new Fiscal year starts as per calendar date then still these postings also need to be captured.

In the third condition, If the system date matches with Calendar Date from I_FiscalCalDatePrevFsclPeriod CDS view and Previous Fiscal Year and Previous Fiscal Period matches with ACDOCA table transaction data Current Fiscal year and Current Fiscal Period then curr_period field will be populated as Y (yes).

 

  • Group by command is also useful to aggregate the number of records based on all fields in CDS view. 

CDS view once ready for SAC import then in import job query filter curr_period field needs to be restricted as Y then only 60 rows for period 4 and 5 have been extracted.

Note: Incase all records need to be extracted for whole Fiscal Year 2025 then curr_period field needs to be removed from query filter then all records for whole Fiscal Year 2025 will be extracted as below. There is a clear difference for period 4 and 5 extraction with field restriction curr_period Y which extracted 60 records but whole 2025 Fiscal year 303 records.

 

 

This solution is applicable as mentioned in the beginning if the factory calendar is maintained in source systems for the financial closings or any other closings.

entry.title: Delta (pseudo) upload: Number of days data upload based on Time stamp with CDS view S4HANA to SAC
entry.content:
Following solution  developed to upload data from S4HANA tables which are having Time stamp field, for example ACDOCA table. Basically, in source systems if any Actuals data entries like Sales, Finance are posted then they should be filled with the date time in the TimeStamp fields in the format YYYYMMDDhhmmss.

Note: This solution helps in case data uploading on detailed level to SAC Model like Sales/Finance Document and Items level and if fields (Document and Document Item) available already in SAC model or if fields not available in the SAC Model then Timestamp (as integer type) field should be added in the SAC model.

If Time stamp or Document and Document Item fields not available in the model, then old entries will be overwritten by new records by either Append or Clean options while data being imported.

 For example, if data is coming on Plant, Cost Center, Fiscal Year and Period level then if any corrections done on same level, then they will be overwritten with new records as import method checks the existing combination in the model data, that’s why either time Timestamp or Document and Document Item fields should be available in the model level then data will be unique.

As per the standard process each posting in ACDOCA table is posted with the Date and time of the postings and the Date and time not relevant to previous entries as explained below. 

 

 

For example, if financial document is posted on item level, then for all those posting will be with one time stamp and for clearing documents and items Timestamp will be different.

As in example below data captured with CDS view from ACDOCA table, field LastChangeDateTime is filled with different time stamp for each Document and Item.

Based on the above logic I have developed the following CDS view which is calculating number of days between current system time stamp and data entries’ time stamp in ACDOCA table.

 

 

In the above CDS view, used standard CDS view I_JournalEntryItemCube which has Timestamp field from ACDOCA table as LastChangeDateTime.

Following two standard commands used:

  • tstmp_to_dats which converts timestamp (YYYYMMDDhhmmss) as date, using this converted LastChangeDateTime field entries as date which is from ACDOCA table and system time stamp (TSTMP_CURRENT_UTCTIMESTAMP() also as date.
  • Another standard command dats_days_between which calculates number of days between two dates which are converted in above 1st step then those number of days will be populated in the field Days_delta.

As an example: if ACDOCA table entry has 20250704123020 which will be converted as 07/04/2025 and if system time stamp is 20250904133100 then it will be converted as 09/04/2025 then days gap between both dates will be calculated as 2 in the field Days_delta.

 

Following is an example  result in the CDS view data:

Days_delta calculated from LastChangeDateTime and System time stamp. I have just applied filter to see less then 20 days then it showed results correct.

 

Ultimately Days_delta field needs to be used in the SAC import job and can be restricted as less than or equal to 1,2, 3 or number of days what ever is preferable.

Note : One important thing as I explained in the beginning, this solution works if data being uploaded on granular level like Sales/Finance documents with Documents items level from the table which has Timestamp field and Document and Item level fields are available in the SAC model already or if Document and Item level fields not available in the SAC Model level then Timestamp (as type integer) field should be added in the SAC model.

entry.title: BW Query statistics not available for CDS-based Queries on transient providers in S/4 HANA system
entry.content:
Hi,

I have built BW Queries on top of CDS Views exposed as transient providers in the S/4HANA system. However, I am unable to find the statistics for these queries.

I have enabled statistics by setting it to 'ON' in Transaction RSDDSTAT, but the data is still not being captured in the underlying table RSDDSTAT_OLAP.

Could you please help me with how to capture statistics for BW Queries in S/4HANA?

Thanks,

K Srinivas

entry.title: Digital Manufacturing cant download SAML Metadata from Initialize Embedded Analytics
entry.content:
Hi
In Digital Manufacturing on BTP I am getting this issue below when I try to download SAML Metadata from Initialize Embedded Analytics > Configuration for Analytics.

<ErrorMessage>
<correlationId>c41f69cc-4b30-480c-9c45-44722537ea60</correlationId>
<message>Cannot find OEM tenant for tenant with ID XXXXXXX</message>
</ErrorMessage>

Where XXXXXXX is the BTP Subaccount.

The issue does not occur on other subaccounts within the same Global Account.
The only difference is that I migrated the Trust Config from SAML2 to OIDC on this BTP subaccount.

Any help with this appreciated
Thanks
Ger

entry.title: SAC’s Time Hierarchy limitation with SuccessFactors Live OData Connection
entry.content:
Summary

We need to configure a month-, quarter-, and year-level headcount and attrition time-series analyses over a history in SAC, based on the SuccessFactors fields Date of Joining and Last Working Date. However, under a live OData connection from SuccessFactors, SAC treats those fields as plain dimensions—because OData maps ABAP’s date types to Edm.DateTime and SAC’s live connector doesn’t infer the SAC “Date” semantic type—which prevents SAC’s native time hierarchies (Year → Quarter → Month → Week → Day) from being available. The following post outlines the business context, the precise problem face : 

1. Business Scenario

To build time-series analyses for headcount and attrition metrics leveraging live data from SAP SuccessFactors. The end users require:

  • Headcount snapshots of total active employees at each period end, and

  • Attrition rates calculated as leavers during the period divided by average headcount,
    broken down by calendar year, quarter, month, and week, with drill-down capability and filters by department, region, job family, and other organizational dimensions. 

This must operate entirely over the existing live OData connection—we cannot import or replicate data to any other platform (BW, HANA, Datasphere or WFA). 

2. Problem Statement

Under SAC’s live OData connection to SuccessFactors, fields such as Date of Joining and Last Working Date arrive as Edm.DateTime properties in the OData service and are ingested by SAC as generic dimensions without any date semantics. As a result:

  • SAC’s predefined calendar hierarchies (Year → Quarter → Month → Week → Day) are not generated for these dimensions, because SAC only auto-creates them on dimensions explicitly tagged with the SAC Date semantic type in import models. 

  • Model-level configuration is read-only in a live model, so you cannot reassign semantic types or define hierarchies for these fields within SAC. 

  • Native drill-down functionality in charts—users clicking from Year down to Month or Week—is unavailable for these date attributes, blocking standard time-series analytics. 

I’m looking for suggestions or ideas on how to tackle a specific requirement using a live OData-only SAC model. If anyone knows of any workarounds, lesser-known features, or upcoming updates that might help in this scenario, I’d really appreciate it. Thanks!

entry.title: how to enable custom fields hierarchies in Analysis For Office
entry.content:
Hi all,

In Group Reporting we have several custom fields created from app "Custom Fields and Logic" ,that are already visible in AO reports. The issue is that I have created their hierarchies from app Manage Global Hierarchies and I would expect them to be displayed in the Analysis For Office report used in SAP S4/HANA Group Reporting 2022 OP, the same way I see the hierarchies for the FS Items but that is not the case.

It seems that it is not possible from app "Custom Analytical Queries" to modify by copy the group reporting standard query in order to activate these custom fields hierarchies.

Could anyone suggest any valid workaround or support in understanding how to handle this and finally get to have the created custom fields' hierarchies displayed?

Thank you.

I am just wondering if this is the expected behavior or if I am missing anything or if there are certain criteria for the entity set to appear in the dropdown.

entry.title: Can we copy unreleased CDS view code and use it for developing custom CDS views?
entry.content:

I was wondering if we can use eclipse to directly copy the CDS view code and create a custom one. Reason being we need to enhance a CDS view but are not able to using standard apps due to the CDS view marked as not released for development. 

 

What would be implications or drawbacks of this approach?

entry.title: Analytical Query: Annotations for Filter by Measure
entry.content:
Hello All, 

I have built a Analytical Query using CDS. I have a requirement to automatically filter out data, which doesn't match specific conditions in few of the Columns(measures).

For eg. assume the condition is to exclude rows wherever Delta is 0

Col1Col2Col3Val1Val2Delta
ABE12-1
ABD220
ACD211
GCE422
GCF330

Depending which Characteristic columns user chooses columns to display, Delta column may result in various values.

Col1Val1Val2Delta
A550
G752
Col3Val1Val2Delta
D431
E541
F330
Col2Col3Val1Val2Delta
BD220
BE12-1
CD211
CE422
CF330

I can achieve this requirement by using "Filter by Measures" at runtime. Is there a way to achieve this via ABAP CDS annotations?

Thank You

Cc: copying some blog authors here for their advice @AndreaUS @joerg_franke @MarkGreen

entry.title: CDS Views for SAC models
entry.content:
Hi,

How to find alternative standard CDS views for the SAC RAPID model (business content).
